Leilane Roberta Macario

  • Endereço para acessar este CV: http://lattes.cnpq.br/4233594278354223
  • Última atualização do currículo em 12/06/2019

PhD and Master in Chemistry at Universidade Estadual Paulista, campus Araraquara and Bachelor in Chemistry with technological assignments at Universidade Federal de São Carlos. I had a postdoctoral position at the University of Waterloo in Professor Holger Kleinke?s research group. In my project, I studied the development of thermoelectric materials based on Bi doped Magnesium Silicides Stannides compounds using Solid State method followed by hot press synthesis procedure. In order to analyze the obtained materials, I used X-ray Diffraction, Scanning Electron Microscopy with Energy Dispersive X-ray Spectroscopy, Thermogravimetry and Differential Scanning Calorimetry, and thermoelectric property measurement techniques. I have experience in synthesis of oxides nano and microstructured (Sn, Zn, Cu, titanates, and zirconates) and doping with rare earth (Eu, Sm) using conventional hydrothermal, microwave hydrothermal, and polymeric precursors methods. In addition, I have experience in growth of perovskite oxides thin films through Pulsed Laser deposition method and spin-coating technique, and production of polymer/ceramic composite as multifunctional materials. The composite films were formed by the junction of ceramic powders with poly vinylidene fluoride polymer by hot pressing method. Regarding characterization techniques, I have used several through my research career, including Scanning Electron Microscopy, Transmission Electron Microscopy, X ray diffraction, FT Raman, photoluminescence spectroscopy, Rietveld refinement, electrical conductivity, and piezoelectricity analysis. I worked as a researcher at Kosmoscience Science and Technology Cosmetics Company for three years after my PhD degree. At this company, I developed and implemented effective assessment methodologies of cosmetic products for hair and home care, using physical chemistry analysis, e.g. Differential Scanning Calorimetry and Energy-dispersive X-ray spectroscopy. I wrote proposals, executed and reported studies as well as I wrote scientific and technical materials. During my entire research career, I have collaborated with new students, by supporting and supervising them to develop their projects. (Texto informado pelo autor)
